abstract: Profile of Marin Alsop, music director of the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra, who has lent some of her musicians prized instruments that once belonged to her late parents Ruth Alsop and K Lamar Alsop; lending instruments have helped Alsop feel closer to her parents and and have given musicians chance to play great instruments that are increasingly outside their financial reach.
lead_paragraph: Marin Alsop, who lost both of her parents last year, has lent their instruments to members of the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra, which she leads.

headline.main: At Baltimore Symphony, a Cello and a Violin Make More Than Music
headline.print_headline: Where a Cello and a Violin Make More Than Music

snippet: Marin Alsop, who lost both of her parents last year, has lent their instruments to members of the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra, which she leads.
